candidates.title: Add 'glsl' feature to gate naga glsl features
candidates.body: This can be used to reduce the final binary size when a consumer only needs WGSL support. I've enabled the feature by default for backwards-compatibility

candidates.title: Update `regex` and `regex-syntax` dependencies
candidates.body: Reduces dependency duplication throughout bevy's dependency tree (other crates use 0.7 while this one uses 0.6)

candidates.title: Rusty imports
candidates.body:
reworks the import mechanism to support more syntax to make it more rusty, and test for item use before importing to determine which imports are modules and which are items, which allows:

- use rust-style imports
```
#import bevy_pbr::{pbr_functions::{alpha_discard as discard, pbr}, mesh_bindings}
```

- import partial paths:
```
#import part::of::path
...
path::remainder::function();
```
which will call to `part::of::path::remainder::function`

- use fully qualified paths without importing:
```
// #import bevy_pbr::pbr_functions
bevy_pbr::pbr_functions::pbr()
```
- use imported items without qualifying
```
#import bevy_pbr::pbr_functions::pbr
// or, for backwards compatibility (i think this style should be deprecated)
// #import bevy_pbr::pbr_functions pbr
...
pbr()
```

- existing code should work without changes (unless it uses `#import`ed overrides), see below

- allows most imported items to end with `_` and numbers (#30). still doesn't allow struct members to end with `_` or numbers but it's progress. 

- includes (a reworking of) #39

- supercedes #24 and #25

- partly breaks overrides - now overrides will only be applied if the overriding module is added as an additional import in the arguments to `Composer::make_naga_module` or `Composer::add_composable_module`. this is necessary to support determining whether imports are modules or items. i think it's a worthwhile trade-off (not sure anybody is using overrides yet)

i've spot-checked bevy, will test more thoroughly after some feedback. would very much appreciate tests from people using the crate outside of bevy core - @DGriffin91, @NiseVoid, @Aaron1011

candidates.title: migrate to naga 0.13
candidates.body:
fixes #33

this should not merged until bevy 0.11.1 is out. builds on @VitalyAnkh's partial migration, with additionally :

- use `Rc<RefCell>` for `const_expressions` and `const_expr_map` - this is basically unavoidable, as `DerivedModule::import_expression` needs access to both the `const_expressions` and the arena to import into, which may also be `const_expressions`
- don't emit `Expression::Literal` and `Expression::ZeroValue`s
- enforce `const_expression` uniqueness with a custom impl of `PartialEq` for `Expression`s, to ensure that the uniqueness test for globals and consts still passes (else we end up with duplicated items, they no longer test as equal as they refer to different `init` expressions). this could be removed if the `PartialEq` derive on `Expression` in naga is made externally available.
- a basic port of the `prune` module which just leaves all `const_expressions` present

the tests pass, but i haven't tried integrating into bevy (which will require bevy to use wgpu 0.17).

candidates.title: require span, bump version
candidates.body:
issue: naga oil requires naga spans to be present but doesn't add the feature.

solution: add the feature, and minor version bump so we can release it.

one of two fixes required for https://github.com/bevyengine/bevy/issues/9028

candidates.title: Update CI
candidates.body:
* don't use deprecated actions
* run tests on all platforms
* run check on Wasm

candidates.title: Bevy changes
candidates.body:
- change the item import syntax from `#from module import item, another_item` to `#import module item, another_items`
- remove requirement to qualify imported items at point of use, `let x = imported_item;` instead of `let x = ::imported_item`
  - replaced the previous regex for import substitution with a manual tokenizer to substitute the imported items, except in import directives themselves
- removed deprecated clone polyfill for various naga types
- cleanup dependencies

candidates.title: Naga 0.12
candidates.body:
based on #18
fixes #17

- bump naga (0.12) and wgpu (0.16) versions
- add required @builtin(position) vertex output for glsl vertex shaders
- add new expressions and statements
- bump naga_oil to 0.7

candidates.title: use BitSet for ModuleKey
candidates.body:
fix #1 by using a BitSet for the module key instead of a usize. this dependency is in naga already.

might be a better way to do this that avoids allocating, but it should at least be correct now for larger sets of shader defs.

candidates.title: bump naga version
candidates.body:
update naga to 0.10
update wgpu to 0.14

compose:
- remove `@location`/`@builtin` bindings from demoted entrypoints (this was previously incorrect but not an error)

in tests:
- update expected output
- use `Cow` for passing modules to wgpu.
- require MAPPABLE_PRIMARY_BUFFERS feature for gpu testing

candidates.title: use BitSet for ModuleKey
candidates.body:
fix #1 by using a `BitSet` for the module key instead of a `usize`. this dependency is in naga already.

might be a better way to do this that avoids allocating, but it should at least be correct now for larger sets of shader defs.
